Name: HMS Bermuda
Fate: Scrapped by Thos W Ward, Briton Ferry, Wales starting on 26 August 1965
Propulsion:
Four oil fired three-drum Admiralty-type boilers
four-shaft geared turbines
four screws
54.1 megawatts (72,500 shp)
Range: 6,520 nmi (12,080 km; 7,500 mi) at 13 knots (24 km/h; 15 mph)
Armament:
Twelve (Nine after 1945 refit) BL 6 inch Mk XXIII naval guns (4 (3) × 3),
eight QF 4 in (102 mm) Mark XVI guns (4 × 2),
eight 40 mm Bofors AA  (4 × 2) guns,
3 quadruple 2-pounder ("pom-pom") AA mounts
12 20 mm AA (6 × 2) guns
Six  21 inch (533 mm) (2 × 3) torpedo tubes
Armour:
Main belt: 83 mm,
Deck: 51 mm,
Turrets: 51 mm,
Director control tower: 102 mm.
Aircraft carried: Two Supermarine Walrus aircraft, removed November 1943.
